meanings.definition: To incline or bend from a vertical position
meanings.sent1: She leaned against the wall for support.
meanings.sent2: He leaned back in his chair to relax.
meanings.sent3: The tree leaned towards the sunlight, eager for warmth.
meanings.sent4: The tower leaned precariously, threatening to fall.
meanings.sent5: The old man leaned on his cane, tired from walking.

meanings.sent1: She leaned on her friends for help during tough times.
meanings.sent2: He leaned on his experience to guide him through the project.
meanings.sent3: The student leaned on his lucky pen to pass the exam.
meanings.sent4: The team leaned on their captain for leadership.
meanings.sent5: The community leaned on each other for support after the storm.

meanings.definition: To exert pressure or force against something
meanings.sent1: She leaned on the door to keep it closed.
meanings.sent2: He leaned against the rock to move it.
meanings.sent3: The wind leaned against the windows, making them rattle.
meanings.sent4: The car leaned on the brakes to stop suddenly.
meanings.sent5: The child leaned on the doorbell, ringing it repeatedly.
